title: How to Make a Powerful Air Pressure Rocket

steps.title: Invert the bottle and cut three flippers of cardboard.
steps.content: Invert the bottle and cut three flippers of cardboard. This is necessary to hold the rocket at launch time. Make your best design.

steps.title: Tape them all to the bottle at an angle of about 120 degrees between them .
steps.content: Tape them all to the bottle at an angle of about 120 degrees between them . Remember, the bottle must be upside down and the flippers must not be taped at the bottle's base. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make a hole through the cork so that the bicycle pump can easily fit into it.
steps.content: Make a hole through the cork so that the bicycle pump can easily fit into it. [2] X Research source Fix the pump tube to it with plasticine.

steps.title: Fill the bottle with water to about 1/4 of the total bottle.
steps.content: Fill the bottle with water to about 1/4 of the total bottle. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Jam in the cork and make the rocket stand.
steps.content: Jam in the cork and make the rocket stand. (flippers do come in handy!)

steps.title: Start pumping as much as possible, but do it quickly.
steps.content: Start pumping as much as possible, but do it quickly. [4] X Research source

steps.title: The pressure builds up so much that the cork and the pump shoot out and the water gushes out.
steps.content: The pressure builds up so much that the cork and the pump shoot out and the water gushes out. Since action has an equal and opposite reaction, the bottle shoots up. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Alternatively, instead of making fins make wings and hold the bottle at an angle for launch.
steps.content: Alternatively, instead of making fins make wings and hold the bottle at an angle for launch.
